definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working

sentences.english: Theat the head of your bed has an automatic waking device.
sentences.chinese: 您牀頭的臺子裝有不傭人的勞力叫醒器。

sentences.english: Rolex is owned by the Hans Wilsdorf Foundation.
sentences.chinese: 漢斯維爾斯多夫基金會擁有勞力士公司。

sentences.english: This technical innovation will save us much time and labour.
sentences.chinese: 這項技術革新可以爲我們節省大量的時間和勞力。

sentences.english: Here you are. Four beautiful fake Rolexes for Nt $5,000.
sentences.chinese: 來，4只漂亮的假勞力士才化了新臺幣5，000塊。

sentences.english: May the creditor seize all his belongings and strangers plunder the fruits of his toil.
sentences.chinese: 使債主搜刮他所有的家產，使外人劫掠他勞力的所賺。

sentences.english: Families would often organize working teams from their surplus labor and send them around to do work for others.
sentences.chinese: 各農戶常把多餘的勞力組織起來實行換工。

sentences.english: I want Rolex , are you buying?
sentences.chinese: 我想要勞力士錶，怎麼，你要買給我嗎？

sentences.english: Rest is the sweet sauce of labor.
E. g. This Rolex is the real McCoy.
He wears traditional salwar kameez and a Rolex watch.
sentences.chinese: 他身着傳統的印度長袍，手上戴一塊勞力士錶。

sentences.english: From the proper employment of forces results public power.
sentences.chinese: 從勞力的合理使用產生大衆的權力。

sentences.english: Many students in the course of employment because of their dedicated and halfheartedly.
sentences.chinese: 很多學生因爲求職過程的勞心勞力而對其敷衍了事。

sentences.english: 2tim. 2:6the Laboring farmer must be the first to partake of the fruit.
sentences.chinese: 提後二6勞力的農夫，理當先分享果實。

sentences.english: Will Rolex introduce AR coatings on the glass?
sentences.chinese: 勞力士會在表蒙上加增透鍍膜嗎？

sentences.english: They proposed to conscript both capital and labour.
sentences.chinese: 他們打算把資金和勞力一起徵用。

sentences.english: Provided always that the provision of labor on a piecework basis shall not be deemed to be a subletting under the Clause.
sentences.chinese: 以計件方式提供勞力不得視爲是本條所規定的分包。

definition: to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
arduous and thankless task (idiom); strenuous and unrewarding
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
to accumulate over a long period of time
